skills.name: Describe a point in the first quadrant of a 2D grid by giving its coordinates, where both values are integers
Mark a point in the second quadrant of a 2D grid having been given its coordinates, where both values are integers
Mark a point in the third quadrant of a 2D grid having been given its coordinates, where both values are integers
Mark a point in the fourth quadrant of a 2D grid having been given its coordinates, where both values are integers
Describe a point on the axes of a 2D grid by giving its coordinates, where the non-zero value is an integer

explanations.A: We read up from the x axis first (3) and then across from the y axis (2). This is written as a coordinate using brackets and a comma (3,2). An easy way to remember this is that it is alphabetical. x before y
explanations.B: I think you've read the correct numbers from the axes, but think carefully about the order. We write alphabetically so it should read (x,y)
explanations.C: Look carefully at the axes. Draw a line down from the point to the x axis and then across from the point to the y axis
explanations.D: Look carefully at the axes. Draw a line down from the point to the x axis and then across from the point to the y axis
